headline: World Ukraine Inspects Mass Graves Retaken City
summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Thursday that a"mass burial site" was discoveredin therecently liberated city of Izyumin eastern Ukraine.Ukrainian officials told multiple news sources thatat least 400 bodies were thought to be buriedat the site, which is marked by hundreds of wooden crosses in a forest near the city. Officials will begin exhuming the graves on Friday to look for signs of torture and war crimes. Russia took control of Izyum early on in the invasion, and used it as a key military hub for its effort to conquer the Donbas region in eastern Ukraine. The recentUkrainian counteroffensivepushed Russians out of the city.A senior adviser to Zelenskyy said that "many places of mass burials" and"many places where people were tortured"had been found in other retaken cities. When Ukraineretook the city of Buchain April, hundreds of bodies of civilians were discovered in mass graves and in the streets, sparking accusations of Russian war crimes.The mass graves in Izyum were covered prominently by news sources across the spectrum, and sources on all sideshighlighted similar aspects of the story.
